          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100178en_GLOBAL/Onin-Staffing-is-Looking-for-1st-and-2nd-Shift-Floor-Support?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>

          <city><![CDATA[Commerce City]]></city>
          <state><![CDATA[Colorado]]></state>

          <postalcode><![CDATA[]]></postalcode>
          <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><span style="color: rgb(45, 45, 45);">The Floor Support position will set up and stage mail, transport mail and supplies to a designated location to facilitate movement of mail and parcels throughout the facility.</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(45, 45, 45);">ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: * Transport mail located in blue bins and or large cardboard box up to 60" tall (Gaylords) throughout the terminal, to designated area, using a pallet jack or other transport equipment * Set-up and stage mail and parcels in designated area * Duties may include reassignment to alternate operational areas as business needs require * Essential duties are not necessarily exhaustive and may be supplemented.</span></p><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><p><span style="color: rgb(45, 45, 45);">6 months related experience preferred</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(45, 45, 45);">REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS: * Understand and carry out oral instructions * Understand standardized math processes, e.g., count, addition and subtraction * Operate pallet jacks * Operate non-power hand tools such as hammers, wrenches, etc. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: * Frequently walk throughout the warehouse in order to move the mail and parcels to proper location within terminal * Frequently push/pull mail and parcels weighing up to 50 pounds, which may include frequent bending, lifting, pushing and pulling * This is a warehouse environment where frequently this position will be exposed to cold, hot and changing temperatures; will constantly experience noise at medium level not damaging or loud enough to require protective equipment; will frequently be exposed to dust, dirt and changes in lighting</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(45, 45, 45);">Job Type: Full-time</span></p><br><br><strong>Benefits </strong><br><p><span style="color: rgb(127, 127, 127);">Onin believes that your health is important. Medical benefits should be affordable and easy to use with your busy schedule. That’s why we offer our teammates custom-built benefits that are affordable and convenient to use. When you’re a part of our team, you have will have affordable benefits you’ll actually want to use such as; $5 Prescription drug copays, $5 Doctor’s Visit copays, Free Teledoctor Service, Free Counseling Services, Life Insurance Included, Vision Insurance Included, Dental Insurance Included, Vacation and Holiday Pay and Scholarship Opportunities. You will get these amazing benefits and more after just 30 days.</span></p><br><br>]]></description>

      <job>
          <title><![CDATA[Production Welder]]></title>
          <date><![CDATA[12/21/2020]]></date>
          <referencenumber><![CDATA[ONINGLOBALP-100071en_GLOBAL]]></referencenumber>
          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100071en_GLOBAL/Production-Welder?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>
          <company><![CDATA[Onin]]></company>
          <city><![CDATA[Creedmoor]]></city>
          <state><![CDATA[North Carolina]]></state>
          <country><![CDATA[United States]]></country>
          <postalcode><![CDATA[]]></postalcode>
          <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p>JOB DUTIES:</p><p>Follow all safety regulations for the individual as well as other employees, including keeping the work area clean and in orderly condition as well as wearing all appropriate safety attire for the job that is being performed. Weld components in flat or vertical positions. Ignite torches or start power supplies and strike arcs by touching electrodes to metals being welded, completing electrical circuits. Clamp, hold, tack-weld, heat-bend, grind and/or bolt component parts to obtain required configurations and positions for welding. Monitor the fitting, burning, and welding processes to avoid overheating of parts or warping, shrinking, distortion, or expansion of material. Examine workpieces for defects, and measure workpieces with straightedges or templates to ensure conformance with specifications. Recognize, set up, and operate hand and power tools common to the welding trade, such as shielded metal arc and gas metal arc welding equipment. Lay out, position, align, and secure parts and assemblies prior to assembly, using straightedges, combination squares, calipers, and rulers.</p><br/><p>WORK ENVIRONMENT:</p><p>Work in an environment that is not environmentally controlled, including very hot conditions in the summer months and little heat in the winter. May also include being exposed to high place, using ladders or scaffolds, and working with hazardous equipment and under hazardous conditions on a daily basis. Required to wear personal protective equipment (PPE) including earplugs, safety glasses and/or goggles, steel toe boots/shoes, weld helmet, welding gloves, work gloves, and a welding jacket or protective welding sleeves.</p><br/><p>WELD TEST INFORMATION:</p><br/><p>Electrode (wire) = ER70S-6</p><br/><p>Electrode Diameter = .052</p><br/><p>Process = GMAW - Pulse (commonly incorrectly referred to as MIG)</p><br/><p>Shielding Gas = Argon/CO2 (92/8 mix)</p><br/><p>Transfer Mode - Spray</p><br/><p>Position = 2G (Horizontal)</p><br/><p>Test Material = A36 plate - 1" thick - single V-Groove/ Single Bevel 45 degrees - w/ backing</p><br/><p>Root opening = 1/4"</p><br/><p>Test Method = Guided bend (Not X-RAY)</p><br/><p>Acceptance Criteria = AWS D1.1 compliance</p><br/><p>20 question written test on your blueprint reading and welding symbol knowledge.</p><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><p>EDUCATION:</p><p>High school diploma or general education degree (GED) from an accredited school is required. Accreditation should be from the US Department of Education.</p><br/><p>CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSES:</p><p>American Welding Society certified is preferred but passing the company’s welding certification is required.</p><br><br><strong>Benefits </strong><br><p>Medical, Dental and Vision insurance for $17.82 a week! Other benefits included as well!</p><br><br>]]></description>

          <title><![CDATA[Heavy Equipment Maintenance Mechanic]]></title>
          <date><![CDATA[12/10/2020]]></date>
          <referencenumber><![CDATA[ONINGLOBALP-100056en_GLOBAL]]></referencenumber>
          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100056en_GLOBAL/Heavy-Equipment-Maintenance-Mechanic?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>
          <company><![CDATA[Onin]]></company>
          <city><![CDATA[Venice]]></city>
          <state><![CDATA[Illinois]]></state>
          <country><![CDATA[United States]]></country>
          <postalcode><![CDATA[]]></postalcode>
          <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p>Essential Duties and Responsibilities:</p><p>Heavy Machinery Mechanic - pay based on verifiable experience</p><p>Experience repairing cranes and front loaders</p><p>Ensure operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by performing and completing regular and preventive maintenance requirements of equipment, machines, and vehicles.</p><p>Perform emergent repairs on equipment and vehicles that break down during the course of the day as schedule and skill set allows.</p><p>Maintain and repair equipment to ensure equipment is compliant with the manufacturer’s requirements and all government regulations, including OSHA and DOT.</p><p>Schedule and perform all oil changes on all equipment based upon hours of use and/or date as required by the manufacturer. As oil changes are performed, samples must be sent off to be analyzed.</p><br/><p>Maintain complete and accurate records for all maintenance and repairs performed.</p><p>These records must include:</p><p>Equipment hours</p><p>Who performed the work</p><p>What specifically was done</p><p>What parts were sourced</p><p>The warranty for any parts and services</p><p>Any additional repairs that will be required</p><br/><p>Control downtime by coordinating with the Maintenance Supervisor or General Manager and communicating with the operators of a routine preventive maintenance schedule.</p><p>Conserve maintenance resources by recommending cost-effective, high-quality parts and/or services as needed to accomplish the expected job results.</p><p>Maintain a safe and clean working environment by complying with company and all regulatory rules and standards.</p><p>Communicate with Maintenance Supervisor and get approval before contracting any major repairs or sourcing any parts outside of those needed for normal maintenance and repairs.</p><p>Possess and maintain a valid driver’s license so as to pick up parts and supplies as needed</p><p>Communicate with maintenance assistant on upcoming tasks, assistance needed, and special instructions or directives for jobs.</p><p>Maintain and ensure compliance of the Lock Out Tag Out (LOTO) program as required by the company and OSHA.</p><p>Ensure that all repairs (equipment and vehicle) are made in accordance with acceptable Code regulations, OSHA standards, DOT standards, and all Becker policies, standards, and procedures.</p><br/><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><p>Additional Experience in the following a plus:</p><p>Electrical AC/DC Experience</p><p>Troubleshooting equipment failures experience</p><p>· Torch experience</p><p>· Experience servicing equipment (ex. This will include maintaining an accurate standard costing environment. As part of the client’s Finance team, you will leverage internal databases, external data sources, financial statements, and other tools to respond to information requests and develop and deliver accurate, fact-based reports &amp; analysis.</span></p><br/><p><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Essential Functions and Responsibilities</strong></p><p><span style="background-color: transparent; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">● Review and analyze daily production orders to provide key insights on monthly plant performance.</span></p><p><span style="background-color: transparent; Control Manager and follows up to ensure that corrective action has/will take place</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Maintains record of inspections and prepares list of This person will oversee planning, coordination and control of all daily production related activities including oversight of production staff, safety training and adherence to all company policies, and recommendations for staffing changes or disciplinary action. Maintaining a clean and well run shop and ensuring all production equipment is properly maintained are also responsibilities of the Production Supervisor.</p><p>Main Tasks &amp; Responsibilities Staff Management</p><ul><li>Supervise and coordinate the activities of the production employees, train as necessary</li><li>Monitor production employees timeliness of arrival, departures and break times, and ensure employees maintain maximum productivity</li><li>Monitor status of temps, work with Production Manager to determine if full time employment will be offered</li><li>Ensure employees are of the skill and quality desired and ensure adherence to Standard Operating Procedures in all operations and activities, including safety.</li><li>Assist with employee performance reviews and recommend raises, disciplinary action or termination to Production Manager</li></ul><p>Production Management</p><ul><li>Daily Production Activities</li><li>Supervise all production activities</li><li>Create and review open orders report</li><li>Schedule operations and workflow to prioritize jobs for maximum efficiency and on-time delivery; bring any issues to Production Manager’s attention</li></ul><p>Maintenance</p><ul><li>Complete preventative maintenance of all equipment per schedule, without delays</li><li>Maintain shop tools in production-ready condition</li><li>Notify Production Manager of potential shortage of shop supplies</li><li>Ensure warehouse and production area are clean and organized</li><li>Remove and dispose of all obsolete inventory, as directed by Production Manager</li></ul><p>Job Type: Full-time</p><p>Pay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year</p><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><br/><p style="text-align: center;"><br></p><br><br><strong>Benefits </strong><br><p>  <span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34);">Onin believes that your health is important.           <referencenumber><![CDATA[ONINGLOBALP-100068en_GLOBAL]]></referencenumber>
          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100068en_GLOBAL/Environmental-Sanitation-Supervisor?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>

          <title><![CDATA[Production Lead ]]></title>
          <date><![CDATA[12/17/2020]]></date>
          <referencenumber><![CDATA[ONINGLOBALP-100241en_GLOBAL]]></referencenumber>
          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100241en_GLOBAL/Production-Lead?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>
          <company><![CDATA[Onin]]></company>
          <city><![CDATA[Garland]]></city>
          <state><![CDATA[Texas]]></state>
          <country><![CDATA[United States]]></country>
          <postalcode><![CDATA[]]></postalcode>
          <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><strong>Production Lead </strong></p><p><strong>Shifts Available: FIRST (5AM - 1PM) / SECOND (1PM - 9AM) / THIRD (9PM TO 5AM)</strong></p><p><strong><em>*MUST BE FLEXIBLE TO WORK ANY SHIFT INCLUDING WEEKENDS*</em></strong></p><p><strong>Pay Rate: $12.00 - 15.00 / hr (Depending on Experience)</strong></p><br/><p><strong><em>Our Opportunity:</em></strong></p><p>The Production Lead works under the direction of the Production Supervisor to coordinate the activities of production workers in order to achieve established production goals. Works as part of the production team to produce the product. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.</p><br/><p><strong>As a Production Lead you will be responsible for the following:</strong></p><ul><li>Know and understand client policies and procedures and comply with all requirements of the quality systems manual, operating and technical procedures and workplace instructions.</li><li>Lead and/or train workgroup, including orientation training, by coordinating, delegating, and checking individuals' work.</li><li>Demonstrate equipment operations, work procedures, safety procedures, and/or assigns employees to experienced workers for mentoring/training and follow up to ensure that the training is sufficient for the employee</li><li>Provide creative leadership and direction to workers to improve operating efficiencies, equipment performance, and ensure safety, quality, and productivity</li><li>Responsible for meeting production quotas with a high rate of accuracy and high level of machine efficiency. Complete work in the time allocated per company labor standards.</li><li>Interpret specifications, drawings, and work orders. Effectively communicate specific instructions to workers in order to meet all requirements.</li><li>Participate in the assembly and other related items in the completion of products according to the work schedule.</li><li>Exercise quality control by comparing the machine produced product to the product’s blueprints templates, and/or specifications. Perform quality checks by evaluating weight, color, size, shape, and/or texture of the product. Measure workpieces to determine accuracy utilizing rulers, templates, or other measuring instruments</li><li>Set up machines and ensure workers perform daily functions as described on MO’s (Material Orders) and Production Schedule. Program computers and electronic instruments such as numerically controlled machine tools.</li><li>Comply with all work-related activities in a fair, ethical, and consistent manner. Notify Production Supervisor of issues and seek direction as needed.</li><li>Responsible for quantity counts of material and scrap.</li><li>Suggest changes in working conditions and use of equipment to increase the safety and efficiency of shop, department, and/or work for crew.</li><li>Confer with supervisors on a regular basis regarding employee performance or other issues that affect the work crew. Suggest plans to motivate workers to achieve work goals<em>.</em></li><li>Maintain accurate information and production records in SAP and RFGEN.</li><li>Estimate, requisition, and inspect materials. Properly account for the materials used.</li><li>Confer with other supervisors /lead persons to coordinate activities or individual departments.</li><li>Support a work environment of continuous improvement and lean initiatives that supports the company and its policies.</li><li>Maintain and improve individual skills by keeping up to date with latest production and production management concepts.</li><li>Responsible for keeping track of company tools and equipment. Ensure that machines, tools, and equipment are cleaned and lubricated in order to remove grease, rust, stains, and foreign matter. Ensure the production floor remains clean and free of debris and spills.</li><li>Responsible for informing and handing over properly the status of machines, lines, and products to the next shift.</li><li>Attend mandatory safety training and complete Bronze lean certification classes, refresher courses, self- improvement classes, and be an active participant in lean events as directed by Supervisor.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li></ul><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><p><strong>Specific qualifications for the role include:</strong></p><ul><li>Requires knowledge equivalent to 1 to 2 years of high school education or 1-year factory/manufacturing-related experience. 4-year high school diploma preferred.</li><li>Basic mathematical knowledge/skills including fractions</li><li>General computer skills.</li><li>Ability to read and interpret a tape measure, protractor, work orders, and/or interpret blueprints and simple drawings required.</li><li>Client Safety training completion required</li><li>Ability to read and write in English a must.</li><li>Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus.</li><li>Ability to safely operate simple hand and power tools such as screwdrivers, pliers, cut-off saws, scan guns, etc. and work levers, buttons, and/or foot pedals, use simple gauges and other instruments</li><li>Ability to understand and execute instructions/directions and troubleshoot production problems. Ability to apply commonsense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.</li><li>Ability to recommend and develop new ideas, approaches, or methods that support the department/company.</li><li>Ability to maintain a safe, clean, and organized work area for self and all others.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of products and services provided at a location</li><li>Reliable, self-motivated, ambitious, resourceful, and quick learner. Positive attitude and willingness to accept new challenges.</li><li>Must be available to work weekends and/or overtime</li><li>Ability to work and concentrate in a noisy environment</li><li>Ability to wear protective equipment such as earplugs, safety glasses, gloves, boots, respirators, welding helmets, etc., and lift up to 50 lbs.</li><li>Ability to timely clock in and out at beginning/end of shift</li></ul><br/><p><strong><em>*Ability to pass a background check, drug screen, and E-Verify*</em></strong></p><br/><p style="text-align: center;"><strong style="color: black;">We don't hire temps, we hire <em>TEAMMATES!</em></strong></p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong style="color: rgb(67, 81, 92);"><img src="https://static-im.phenompeople.com/CareerConnectResources/images/ONINGLOBAL/Joinourteam_1607984717777.png"></strong></p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">If this sounds like the right job for you, please apply online or in-person Monday - Friday from 8am to 5pm! </strong><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Not for you, but someone you know?           <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Reach Truck Operators </strong></p><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Multiple Shifts Available Include: FIRST / SECOND / THIRD<em>**Overtime Mandatory As Required**</em></strong></p><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Pay Rate: $14.50 - 16.50 / hr (depending on department)</strong></p><br/><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Our Opportunity:</strong></p><p><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">One of the world’s largest leading Supply Chain Operators has partnered with Ōnin Staffing to help fulfill their hiring goals.</span></p><br/><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">What you'll do as a Reach Truck Operator:</strong></p><p><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">The Reach Truck Operator is responsible for operating equipment as part of the distribution process within a fast-paced warehouse setting. The Reach Truck Operator will utilize equipment while performing tasks to include shipping, receiving, unloading, scanning, moving, staging, loading, locating, relocating, and stacking product on forklift.</span></p><br/><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Primary Duties:</strong></p><ul><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Reads production schedule, customer order, work order, shipping order, or requisition to determine items to be moved, gathered, and/or distributed</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Pulls and prepares product for shipment, ensuring that the exact number and type of product is loaded</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Sorts and places materials or items on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Assembles customer orders from stock, stage orders and/or conveys orders to packing station or shipping department according to OH or customer pick sheet</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Loads, unloads, moves, stacks and stages products and materials using a Reach Truck, forklift, clamp truck or other power equipment</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Maintains equipment by keeping it clean and safe, reporting service requests as needed</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Assists in maintaining the security of the warehouse by conducting operations in a manner which promotes safety</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Marks materials with identifying information</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Records amounts of materials or items received or distributed</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Weighs or counts items for distribution within warehouse to ensure conformance to company standards</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Efficiently moves and loads product from staging and/or storage areas into trailers</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Unloads inbound freight safely and moves products to storage locations</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Performs picking duties in an efficient manner that meets both company and customer standards</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Assists with physical inventories and cycle counts, ensuring proper stock rotation</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Assists in a distribution center/warehouse cleanup as required</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Other duties as required and assigned by supervisor</span></li></ul><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Education and of experience and/or training in a warehouse environment</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Experience using a minimum of 4 pieces of warehouse equipment</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Exposure to Tier 1 or 2 warehouse management system or comparable system</span></li><li><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">MUST have a <em>minimum of 6 months recent experience operating a Stand-up Reach Truck in a warehouse environment</em></strong></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Previous certification is a plus, but not mandatory</span></li></ul><br/><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Essential Skills:</strong></p><ul><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Ability to follow safety regulations while operating equipment</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Ability to regularly lift up to 50 pounds</span></li><li><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Ability to learn proper operations of warehouse equipment</span></li></ul><br/><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Environment:</strong></p><p><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">While performing the duties of this job the employee will be required to stand, walk, use hands and fingers, reach with hands and arms. This position may be required to stoop, kneel, or crouch as it relates to product handling and distribution, and must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. This position may occasionally lift more than 50 pounds. electrical substation control buildings and communication shelters is seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Personnel that can immediately contribute to increasing capacity within our Concrete           <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><strong>Excellent clean, temperature controlled, professional work environment!</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Option to Buy into the Company when you get hired on!!</strong></li></ul><p><strong>**BILINGUAL ENCOURAGED TO APPLY**</strong></p><p><strong>Essential Functions</strong>:</p><ul><li>Cut tubes for production</li><li>Load raw material in machines</li><li>Repack raw materials</li><li>Pack out finished goods</li><li>Fill propane tanks for forklift</li><li>Ability to Operate Splicer</li><li>Relief operator</li><li>Assist machine operators with doffing</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li><li>Ability to work independently in a fast-paced manufacturing environment and adhere to health and safety requirements.</li><li>Ability to read and interpret process and performs visual inspections and quality testing</li><li>Monitors the production process and performs visual inspections and quality testing.</li><li>Ability to make timely decisions that affect Safety, Quality and Efficiency</li><li>Ability to perform the essential functions of the job such as frequently lifting and moving 50lb packages while standing for extended periods, bending, squatting or kneeling</li><li>Maintains proper housekeeping standards and performs operator maintenance</li><li>Ability to learn technical processes to operate equipment and machinery</li><li>Ability to achieve a forklift certification</li><li>Maintain efficient production daily while setting up machines and packaging out products for shipping</li><li>And other duties as assigned</li></ul><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><ul><li>The candidate must be dependable, detail-oriented, and able to follow directions. As an Ōnin Teammate you would work as a welder in our covered fabrication shop. Utilizes prints to fabricate sprinkler system components to be installed by field crews. Performs lightweight pipe welding on carbon steel and stainless-steel pipe and/or fittings for fire sprinkler systems which will transport water (not chemicals or explosives) throughout a wide range of facilities. Welds saddle outlets, beams, and brackets (angle iron), and performs butt welds. Maintains high quality work and performs other duties within the Fabrication Shop as necessary. We provide weekly pay, benefits, overtime opportunities, and the ability to advance your career.</span></p><p><strong style="color: black;">Job Duties:</strong></p><ul><li><span style="color: The teammate verifies on-going conformance with established quality standards and rejects non-conforming parts for inconsistent color, function, fit, and cosmetic defects.</span></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><br></p><p><strong style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent;">Essential Functions </strong><em style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); background-color: transparent;">(To perform within this position successfully, the teammate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.       <job>
          <title><![CDATA[Automation Technician]]></title>
          <date><![CDATA[12/16/2020]]></date>
          <referencenumber><![CDATA[ONINGLOBALP-100404en_GLOBAL]]></referencenumber>
          <url><![CDATA[https://jobs.oningroup.com/global/en/job/ONINGLOBALP-100404en_GLOBAL/Automation-Technician?utm_source=indeed&utm_medium=phenom-feeds]]></url>
          <company><![CDATA[Onin]]></company>
          <city><![CDATA[Buffalo Grove]]></city>
          <state><![CDATA[Illinois]]></state>
          <country><![CDATA[United States]]></country>
          <postalcode><![CDATA[]]></postalcode>
          <description><![CDATA[<strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><strong>GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO WORK WITH AN ESSENTIAL COMPANY!</strong></p><br/><p><strong>Direct Hire</strong></p><p><strong>12/hr rotating Shifts (6p-6a or 6a-6p)</strong></p><ul><li>Analyze reject, downtime, vision data and operator input to actively identify causes of yield/productivity loss</li><li>Perform complex/precise mechanical adjustments and troubleshoot precision mechanisms/devices to maintain optimal line performance</li><li>Maintain, troubleshoot and repair complex systems, including precision mechanical cam driven motions, rotary &amp; linear servos, pneumatic actuators and a wide variety of sensors/measuring devices</li><li>Respond to machine alarms as they occur, identify the root cause, correct as needed</li><li>Troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, pneumatic and vacuum systems and return to serviceability</li><li>Repair and maintain electrical controls on molding, assembly and packaging machines</li><li>Repair pick and place tooling, mechanical systems, and controls, calibrate and adjust pick/place points</li><li>Read and interpret electrical and pneumatic schematics, mechanical drawings and flow charts</li><li>Perform scheduled preventive maintenance actions on all subsystems and related components</li><li>Rebuild and repair critical devices and components</li><li>Assist automation team in validation and Measurement System Analysis of automated systems</li><li>Assists with customer presentations and interfaces with customers</li><li>Records procedures and results, numerical and graphical data, and recommendations for changes in product or method</li><li>Maintain continuous system operation by adjusting, repairing, replacing, or modifying automation/robotic system components</li><li>Maintains software, documentation and equipment to the latest revision or operational specifications</li></ul><br><br><strong>Work Experience </strong><br><ul><li>Strong experience in preventive maintenance</li><li>Minimum 2-year experience working in manufacturing operations as an automation technician/ field service technician/ Equipment maintenance technician or related experience</li><li>Strong mechanical aptitude and demonstrated understanding of mechanical systems/devices.</li><li>Working knowledge of electrical and control systems/devices</li><li>Understanding of PLCs, I/O and logic</li><li>Understanding of automated manufacturing principles and If so, become a valuable member of our team as a grinder, inspecting products as they come out of the machinery, removing any defective pieces and providing the finishing touches on the rest by hand. You will use your profound knowledge of how the machinery works to ensure that it remains functional by performing routine maintenance, cleaning and repairs. Your problem-solving skills will come in handy as you keep the machinery running and reduce any potential gaps in production in a fast-paced environment that cannot afford to lose any time due to machinery malfunctions.</span></p><p><span style="color: rgb(67, 81, 92);">Job Responsibilities</span></p><ul><li>Inspect machinery and workpieces to ensure that they remain compliant with specifications to reduce any malfunctions and associated loss of production.</li><li>Ensure grinding wheels are dressed according to specifications so that the machines remain at peak working capability.</li><li>Stop any machines upon discovery of a problem and make the required adjustments as quickly as possible to minimize downtime.</li><li>Provide quality control by inspecting workpieces as they come out of the equipment and removing any defective pieces.</li><li>Operate machinery, including polishing and grinding equipment, to grind any metal workpieces to their prescribed specifications to ensure high-quality products.</li><li>Finish products by hand using hand tools to ensure the surfaces are filed or finished accordingly.</li><li>Keep all equipment running by inspecting and performing basic maintenance, including lubrication and cleaning, and scheduling repairs when needed.</li><li>Perform basic repairs, including replacing parts when they are worn down or broken, within the scope of expected knowledge and expertise.</li></ul><p><span style="color: rgb(67, 81, 92);">Job Skills &amp; Having prior experience in a human resources environment increases job competitiveness. When you’re a part of our team, you will have affordable benefits you’ll actually want to use such as; $5 Prescription drug copays, $5 Doctor’s Visit copays, Free Teledoctor Service, Free Counseling Services, Life Insurance Included, Vision Insurance Included, Dental Insurance Included, Vacation and Holiday Pay and Scholarship Opportunities.
